Heimerdinger is a chat-style desktop app that manages your tasks (ToDo / Deadline / Event) through natural, typed commands.
It replies in a Piltover scientist voice and persists your tasks to disk. For science and progress!
- See an **agenda** for a given date with `schedule`
- Enjoy a clean chat UI (user vs bot bubbles, error highlighting)
event <description> /from <yyyy-MM-dd OR yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd OR yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>

* Custom exception type for the Heimerdinger application.

*

This exception is thrown to signal user-facing or domain-specific errors
* during command parsing, execution, or persistence. It is intended to wrap
* validation failures, invalid inputs, or storage-related issues in a way that
* can be cleanly surfaced to the user.

*

Examples of when this exception may be thrown:

*
  • User omits a required command argument (e.g., missing deadline date).

*
  • User provides an invalid index (e.g., out of bounds in {@code mark} or {@code delete}).

*
  • File I/O errors when reading or saving tasks in {@link heimerdinger.Storage}.

* Base type for all user-invoked commands.

*

A {@code Command} encapsulates a single action parsed from user input,
* and executes against the current {@link TaskList}, displays messages via {@link Ui},

*
  • The parser creates a concrete {@code Command} with its arguments.

*
  • {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)} is invoked to perform the action.

*

Subclasses must implement {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)} to define behavior.

*

Concrete implementations typically mutate {@code tasks}, show a message via {@code ui},
* and persist changes through {@code storage}. Some commands (e.g., {@link ExitCommand})
* may instead just signal application termination without modifying tasks.
* @param tasks   the live task list to read and modify; must not be {@code null}
* @param ui      the UI sink used to display messages; must not be {@code null}
* @param storage the persistence layer used to save any changes; must not be {@code null}
* @throws HeimerdingerException if validation fails, persistence fails, or a domain error occurs
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws HeimerdingerException;

{@code TaskList} serves as the central container for tasks in the
